alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 24 at 3:58AM PST until February 26 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For Friday morning through Sunday, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 30 inches, except 2 to 4 feet above 7000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 75 mph in the Sierra with gusts up to 50 mph in valley locations. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...From 4 AM Friday to 4 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...After snow showers today and tonight, steady snow moves into the region before daybreak Friday. Travel along US-395 and Highway 6 through Mono County and points south could be greatly impacted due to blowing snow and near whiteout conditions.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
